page.title: 11POWER STATION,ST.HELIER
page.content: The power station is situated at La Collette, close to the harbour on land reclaimed from the sea. It is an oil fired power station. The oil arrives by tanker and is then pumped into storage tanks. The tanker arrives every 8-10 days in winter and 15-18 days in the summer. Oil stocks are sufficient to last for one month. Three steam and four diesel powered turbines produce up to 110 mega watts. Sea water is used as a coolant at the rate of 22,500 gallons per minute. La Collette was opened in 1965, replacing the Queen's Road coal power station. In April 1985, a link between Jersey and Surville in France was opened which allows cheaper electricity to be imported from the French National Grid.
